note.p: Education: Brasenose College, Oxford; BA (1694), MA (1699), BMed (1708), DMed (1711)
Career: Fellow of Oriel College, Oxford (1699); practised in Lewes, Sussex (c1705)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; Foster; Munk's Roll
Notes: Note in BR states that this fellow was possibly a John Whalley, a professor of theology at Cambridge during the 1730s and 1740s. The name also appears in the Diary of Thomas Birch.
